subject: Economics
title: The Digital Divide: When Technology Deepens Inequality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Digital Divide: When Technology Deepens Inequality.

hook.text: During COVID, millions of US students couldn't attend online school.

buildup.text: The digital divide: unequal access to technology, broadband, and digital skills. 2.

twist.text: Even in rich countries, the divide is deep. Rural America has slower internet than many developing nations.

climax.text: Technology that could be the great equalizer instead becomes the great amplifier.

punchline.text: The internet can lift everyone. But only if everyone can get on.

quiz.question: How does the digital divide compound existing inequality?
options: Those without internet access are excluded from jobs, education, healthcare, and government services that increasingly require digital connectivity
